Description: Fragment of a votive offering, maybe of a small stela (?), in limestone with sunken-relief; carved representation of an ear on one side, with undetermined device to right; traces of red painting in ear.
Curator's comments: Small fragment of a so-called ear-stela, common Egyptian votive offering. Similar hastily made ones were found at Memphis, in the vicinity of the enclosure wall of Ptah. They are sometimes considered to be modest offerings. For a possible second ear-stela from Naukratis, see Boston, Museum of Fine Arts RES.88.46. The object was deaccessioned, but according to its description and size, it looks very similar to this piece.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MD.1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
